title: Citi Successfully Implements First RMB Cross-border Auto Sweeping Structure for Chinese Company
summary: Shanghai - Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today announced that it has successfully implemented the first RMB Cross-Border Auto Sweeping Structure for Texhong Textile Group Limited, a leading international company in China focusing on manufacturing high value-added core-spun cotton textile products. Citi has implemented a similar solution for an international shipping company; however, this is the first of its kind for a Chinese company, and signifies the RMB as a truly global currency.
tag-1: Citi Successfully Implements First RMB Cross-border Auto Sweeping Structure for Chinese Company
tag-3: Shanghai – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today announced that it has successfully implemented the first RMB Cross-Border Auto Sweeping Structure for Texhong Textile Group Limited, a leading international company in China focusing on manufacturing high value-added core-spun cotton textile products. Citi has implemented a similar solution for an international shipping company; however, this is the first of its kind for a Chinese company, and signifies the RMB as a truly global currency.
tag-4: As Texhong continues to pursue an ambitious international strategy, according to Charles Hui, CFO of Texhong Textile Group Limited: "The company was looking to implement a strategic global liquidity structure that would match its growth strategy, specifically one that integrates its overseas and domestic funding structures to gain maximum efficiency. We are pleased that Citi has helped us achieve these objectives."
tag-5: By implementing the automated cross-border sweeping structure, which is integrated with the domestic cash pool, Texhong is now able to efficiently manage global working capital funding needs and significantly reduce their external funding costs in overseas markets. In addition, Texhong can leverage Citi's solution to ensure compliance with regulations and gain visibility and control over transactions.
tag-6: Launched in September against the backdrop of new regulatory developments, the solution marked the latest effort from Citi China on facilitating RMB cross-border activities through automating clients' lending and repayment process.
tag-7: Pei Yigen, Country Head of Citi's Treasury and Trade Solutions for China, said: "This is a milestone solution in the development of RMB internationalization. It increases the importance of RMB in global liquidity management for Chinese companies going abroad, and will in turn facilitate the usage of RMB cross-border trade settlement globally. Citi is proud to be playing an active role in this process."
tag-8: As a global leader in liquidity management, Citi has been working in close partnership with clients to develop sophisticated solutions in the evolving market. "RMB and China are key strategic areas for our clients. Citi will continue to expand and reinforce our RMB capabilities globally and enable our clients to maximize liquidity management opportunities with the evolving regulations," said Sandip Patil, Head of Regional Liquidity Management Services, Asia Pacific, Citi.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-11: Citi China Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today, Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has 13 corporate bank branches – in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi – and 52 consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
tag-12: Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions  Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS), provides integrated cash management and trade finance services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations across the globe. With a full range of digital and mobile enabled platforms, tools and analytics TTS continues to lead the way in delivering innovative and tailored solutions to its clients. It offers the industry's most comprehensive suite of treasury and trade solutions including cash management, payments, receivables, liquidity management and investment services, working capital solutions, commercial and prepaid card programs, trade finance and services. As of the first quarter of 2013, average deposits and other customer liability balances were $415 Billion.
